thread.title: NatWest customers furious as systems go down AGAIN putting ATMS and cards out of use
thread.title_full: NatWest customers furious as systems go down AGAIN putting ATMS and cards out of use

title: NatWest customers furious as systems go down AGAIN putting ATMS and cards out of use
text:
NatWest customers furious as systems go down AGAIN putting ATMS and cards out of use NatWest customers furious as systems go down AGAIN putting ATMS and cards out of use CUSTOMERS of NatWest were unable to withdraw cash or make payments today, as the bank suffered another system glitch. PUBLISHED: 14:37, Tue, Sep 8, 2015 | UPDATED: 16:04, Tue, Sep 8, 2015 GETTY NatWest users have been hit with another systems glitch 
Angry customers vowed to cancel their accounts with NatWest after thousands of people were unable to use their debit card when the bank's ATM and chip and PIN systems seized up this morning. Frustrated users said they were "fuming" that they were unable to take cash out. Others said they had been left trying for half an hour to process payments. Angry customers turned to social media site Twitter in an effort to find out what was happening.Many said today's failure was the final straw and vowed to vote with their feet and switch banks. Chris Walder wrote: "Another day another Another day another #Natwest meltdown luckily not affected this time. How many more times can this happen?"Another user Rob Perks said: "My card has been declined in three separate cashpoint was working fine yesterday What is going on"The RBS-owned bank said the issues are now resolved and apologised to inconvenienced users. 
Today's problems are just the latest in a string of malfunctions for customers of RBS and NatWest 
The month before customer's payments went 'missing' and red-faced bosses were again forced to apologise for IT systems.Around 18 months ago, customers were also unable to access accounts or withdraw money. 
An RBS spokesperson said:“Some customers may have experienced difficulties using our ATM network, and Chip and PIN facilities within our branches for a short period of time this morning. These issues have now been resolved. 
"We apologise for the inconvenience caused to those customers affected." . @NatWest_Help I know I'm a poor student, but it would be nice to withdraw money when I want to!! #embarrassingmomentonthehighstreet — Livi Wilkes (@LiviWilkesPR) September 8, 2015 @NatWest_Help too little to late! Customers should vote with their feet and switch banks! I am! — Paul Turner (@Cyberfarquar) September 8, 2015 @NatWest_Help when will this issue be resolved?Now I cant use PayPal!My regular Netflix payment has stopped as a result.This isnt acceptable
